content: it makes me feel nostalgic and it's also a bit sour. I also like the idea of a "near-life experience", it makes me think of being depressed or in a very low mood and doing something that brings closer to almost feeling alive. It's also feeling like someone is saying "you're almost there, you're almost living up to the full potential life can offer". It's a nice subversion of the casual "near-death experience".
